translation: The Eighty-second and Eighty-second Parts of the Entry into the Palace of the King

source_sentence: 爾時薄伽梵在王舍城竹林園中。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān was staying at the bamboo grove in the city of Rājagṛha.

source_sentence: 時有南方壯士，力敵千夫，來至此城詣影勝王所，自言勇健弓馬無雙。
translation: At the time, there were strong men of the south with a thousand troops and enemies who came to this city and went to the place where King Shōshō was staying. They said that they were unsurpassed by other brave warriors such as bows and horses.

source_sentence: 王見歡喜加之重祿，授其大將。
translation: The king was delighted to see the great reward and gave it to the general.

source_sentence: 時摩揭陀憍薩羅二國中間大曠野處，有五百群賊殺害商旅，由斯兩界人行路絕。
translation: At the time, there were five hundred bands of thieves in the great wilderness between the two kingdoms of Magadha and Kośala who killed merchants and traveled on the roads of the two realms.

source_sentence: 時影勝王聞是事已命大將曰：「卿可往彼二國中間曠野之處屏除群賊，權住於彼。」
translation: After hearing this, the king of Vaiśeṣika told the general, You may go to the wilderness between those two countries and shield yourself from the thieves and have the right to live there.

source_sentence: 時彼大將奉王教已，將諸左右往曠野中，見彼群賊將便獨進，鋒矢交刃射一百人。
translation: The general then, following the king's instruction, led his men to the wilderness and saw that group of thieves who were about to advance alone, with their swords pointing at each other and firing a hundred shots.

source_sentence: 餘四百人尚來共戰，其將告曰：「汝等莫前，勿令俱死，宜釋甲仗，去傷者箭觀其活不？」
translation: The other four hundred men were still coming to fight together, and their generals told them, Don't go ahead; don't let them both die; why wouldn't you release your armor and arrows to remove the wounded?

source_sentence: 諸賊聞已看被射者，為去其箭尋並命終，方知大將善閑射法，更不敢戰，餘四百人求哀請活。
translation: When the thieves heard this and saw that the arrow had been shot, they abandoned the arrow in order to search for it but all died. Only then did they know that General Sunetra was practicing archery at leisure and didn't dare to fight; the other four hundred people were crying out in sorrow to ask for their lives.

source_sentence: 大將愍之慈心向彼，即於二界築一新城，總集諸人共住於此，從斯已後名曠野城。
translation: The great general's compassionate mind of pity is directed toward them, so he builds a new city in the two realms and gathers all the people together to live here, which will be called the wilderness city after that.

source_sentence: 時此城人眾共立制，若有嫁娶皆延大將先令食已，方為歡讌。
translation: The people of this city then established a common rule that if they marry, the general Yan would first order them to eat and then become delighted.

source_sentence: 時有一人家極貧窶，欲為婚娶無容辦食以命大將，即自思念：「我貧無力請大將來，今此新妻身未相觸，宜當進奉以表素心。」
translation: At the time, there was a man from a very poor family who wanted to marry an unworthy wife and prepare food for the general. He then thought to himself, I'm too poor to invite the general to come, but now that this new wife hasn't touched me, it's better to offer support to express my humble mind.

source_sentence: 便令其妻入將軍室方始歸家，從此已後城內諸人以此為式。
translation: He then ordered his wife to enter the general's room before he returned home, and after that, the people in the city made this their ritual.

source_sentence: 時有女子欲為婚娶便作是念：「此城諸人久行非法，自娉妻室先與他人，欲作何緣能絕斯事？」
translation: When a woman wanted to marry, she thought, What's the reason the people in this city have long practiced unlawfully and given their wives and houses to others before they want to do so?

source_sentence: 便於晝日眾人聚處裸立小便，諸人見已皆叱之曰：「汝是童女理合羞慚，何故對眾人前作非禮事？」
translation: She then stood naked in front of the crowd and urinated, and when they saw her, they all scolded her, Why are you a young woman so shameful to do unseemly things for the crowd?

source_sentence: 女子報曰：「若對丈夫可有羞恥，對諸婦女何所羞慚？」
translation: The woman replied, If you can have shame toward men, what shame can you have toward women?

source_sentence: 諸人對曰：「我非丈夫耶？」
translation: The people said, Isn't I a husband?

source_sentence: 女子報曰：「若是丈夫者豈有自娶己妻先令他犯！」
translation: The woman replied, If this is a husband, how could he take his own wife and first cause others to violate it?

source_sentence: 諸人聞已各起深慚，即便共議：「我等可詳殺其大將。」
translation: After the people heard this, they each became deeply ashamed and even discussed it together, Let's kill the general in detail.

source_sentence: 伺彼入池洗浴之際，諸人總集以劍刺之，彼欲命終即便念曰：「非我本意汝自樂為，今實無辜枉斷我命。」
translation: When he entered the pool to wash and bathe, all the people gathered together and stabbed him with their swords, and when he wanted to die, they thought, It's not that I originally intended you to do it for your own sake, but now there's really no fault in cutting off my life.

source_sentence: 遂發邪願：「願我捨此身後生暴惡藥叉，食此城中所有男女。」
translation: He then made a mistaken vow, saying, May I abandon this body and give birth to a violent yakṣa who will eat all the men and women in this city after me.

source_sentence: 發是願已尋即命終，受藥叉身於此曠野叢林中住。
translation: After making this vow, he'll die and receive the body of a yakṣa and live in this wild jungle forest.

source_sentence: 由其前身怨讎業故，於此城中作大災害人多病死。
translation: Because of their past enemies and resentful actions, many people in this city committed great misdeeds and died from illness.

source_sentence: 諸人知已皆往林中懺謝前過，請於每日常輸一人以充彼食。
translation: Knowing this, the people all went to the forest to repent of their past transgressions and asked that one person be provided with food every day.

source_sentence: 凡次死者於其門上懸牓告知，或家主自行、或遣男女充其飲食。
translation: Whenever dies, he's hung up at his door to announce it, or the owner of the house may go on his own or send a man or woman to fill their food and drink.

source_sentence: 時有長者，於百神所求得一子，初誕之時門上見牓，其婦憂愁懷抱嬰孩悲啼而住。
translation: At the time, there was an elderly man who had sought a child at the homes of hundreds of deities. When he was first born, he saw a dispute in the doorway, and his wife grieved with sadness as she embraced a baby, weeping and standing there.

source_sentence: 夫從外來見牓而進，知婦憂苦報其婦曰：「業屬如此事當奈何？
translation: When the husband came from outside and saw the woman's anger, he knew that she was grieved and suffered a painful retribution. The wife said, What should I do for this kind of work?

source_sentence: 汝不須憂，勿生愛戀，宜將兒子送與藥叉。」
translation: You don't need to worry, don't become attached, and it's better for you to send your son to the yakṣa.

source_sentence: 「靈祇遍滿於世間，　　自伏諸根能濟物；
translation: Spiritual manifestations pervade all worlds, Suppressing their own faculties and being able to save things.

source_sentence: 我為孩子求哀禮，　　願見慈悲相救護。」
translation: I beg for my children's compassionate homage and wish to see them rescued by kindness and pity.

source_sentence: 作是語已抱其孩子送至林處，夫妻還歸昇高樓上，四方觀察慇懃敬禮說伽他曰：爾時世尊常以佛眼觀察眾生，如餘廣說，乃至如母牛隨犢。
translation: After saying this, he took his child and sent him to the forest, returned home, ascended to a high building, looked around in all directions with respect and veneration, and said to Kāṭa, At that point, the Bhagavān always observes sentient beings with the Buddha's eye, as explained in detail above, even like a mother cow following a calf.

source_sentence: 「云何丈夫最勝財？　　云何修行能利樂？
translation: “What is a man’s supreme treasure, and how can he cultivate it for profit or pleasure?

source_sentence: 云何味中為第一？　　云何命中為最勝？」
translation: What is the best of all flavors and what is the supreme among life?

source_sentence: 「信為丈夫最勝財，　　善法常修能利樂，
translation: “Faith is the supreme wealth of a man, Always cultivating virtuous qualities for the benefit and welfare of all.

source_sentence: 諸味之中實語最，　　於諸命中慧為勝。」
translation: Among the flavors, real words are the best, and among the lives, wisdom is superior.

source_sentence: 「云何足珍財？　　云何有名稱？
translation: “What are the treasures of endowments and what are their names?

source_sentence: 云何人所敬？　　云何善友增？」
translation: What is respected by people and what increases the number of good friends?

source_sentence: 「好施足珍財，　　持戒有名稱，
translation: They are fond of giving gifts of rare treasures, And observe the precepts well known for their observance.

source_sentence: 實語人所敬，　　無慳善友增。」
translation: They really say they're respected by people, and there's no stinginess or increase in good friends.

source_sentence: 「世間由幾生？　　由幾得名稱？
translation: “World-honored One, how many times does the world arise and how many times does it receive its name?

source_sentence: 由幾能成立？　　由幾能衰損？」
translation: How many are capable of being established and how many are capable of being weakened?

source_sentence: 「世間由六生，　　由六得名稱，
translation: The world is born of the six, and it gets its name from the six.

source_sentence: 由六能成立，　　由六能衰損。」
translation: It's because of the six powers that they establish and because of the six powers that they weaken.

source_sentence: 「云何離愚癡，　　晝夜無羈絆，
translation: “How is it that you’re free of folly and have no restraints day or night?

source_sentence: 能於緣不住，　　不怖於深坑？」
translation: Can you not abide in conditions and not fear deep pits?

source_sentence: 「定慧離愚癡，　　捨著無羈絆，
translation: “Concentration and wisdom are free of folly, relinquishing attachment to un restrained bonds.

source_sentence: 於境緣不住，　　持戒越深坑。」
translation: They don't abide in the conditions of objects, and their observance of precepts transcends the deep pit.

source_sentence: 「誰能渡瀑流？　　誰能越大海？
translation: Who can cross the water and who can cross the great ocean?

source_sentence: 誰能離諸苦？　　誰得心清淨？」
translation: Who can be freed from suffering and attain purity of mind?

source_sentence: 「信能渡瀑流，　　謹慎越大海；
translation: “Faith is able to cross the floods and rivers, And with caution transcend the great sea.

source_sentence: 精勤離諸苦，　　有慧心清淨。
translation: Being diligent and free of suffering, he has a pure mind of wisdom.

source_sentence: 汝今咸可問，　　沙門婆羅門，
translation: All of you should now ask the following questions:

source_sentence: 離實語布施，　　更有勝法不？」
translation: Is there another superior teaching that's free of generosity given in true words?

source_sentence: 「我今何假問，　　沙門婆羅門？
translation: Why should I now ask, Sramana- brāhmaṇa?

source_sentence: 世尊大智海，　　能說真妙法。
translation: Bhagavān, the great ocean of wisdom, can teach the true and marvelous Dharma.

source_sentence: 我從今日後，　　遊履於人間，
translation: From today on, I'll wander among the people.

source_sentence: 常禮佛世尊，　　敬重於正法。
translation: He always pays homage to the Buddha, the Bhagavān, and venerates the right teaching.

source_sentence: 世尊大慈愍，　　降臨我住處；
translation: The World-honored One’s great compassionate benevolence Has descended upon my dwelling place.

source_sentence: 我今決定知，　　當盡生死際。」
translation: Now, I'm certain to know for sure that I'll end birth and death.

source_sentence: 「蜜跡手授我，　　我手授父母；
translation: The traces of honey are handed to me, while my hand is given to my parents.

source_sentence: 由手相傳故，　　應名曠野手。」
translation: Because it's transmitted from hand to hand, it should be called a wild hand.

source_sentence: 佛為憐愍長者妻子，及曠野城中諸男女故，知此城中堪受教化，漸次遊行至曠野處，為暴惡藥叉說微妙法令生淨信，為受三歸及五學處，乃至藥叉說頌請曰：世尊告曰：藥叉請曰：世尊告曰：藥叉請曰：世尊告曰：藥叉請曰：世尊告曰：藥叉請曰：世尊告曰：藥叉答曰：爾時藥叉持此童子奉上世尊，世尊受已授與父母，即說頌曰：孩兒因此名曠野手，年漸長大。
translation: Knowing that the mercy of the wealthy man’s wife and the men and women in the wilderness city were capable of receiving instruction from this city, the Buddha gradually traveled to the wilderness for the sake of the cruel yakṣa who taught him the subtle Dharma so that they would give rise to pure faith. In order to receive the Three Refuges (i.e., the precepts) and the five

source_sentence: 時曠野城未有君主，眾人共議，此曠野手童子有大福德，親蒙世尊之所護念：「我等宜可策以為王。」
translation: The city of the wilderness didn't have a ruler, and the people agreed to discuss it together. This young boy in the wilderness had great merit and was personally protected by the Bhagavān, saying, It's advisable for us to make him king.

source_sentence: 爾時世羅苾芻尼，從勝音城將除患大臣女名曰紺容付，與妙音長者令其養育，年既長成儀容端正，眾所愛敬國內無雙。
translation: It was then that the Śīlabhadra Bhikṣuṇī, a woman named Maitrāyaniputra, a minister who was about to remove her illness from the city of Vaiśravaṇa, gave her to the elder Miaoyin to nurture her. As she grew up, she became so beautiful and handsome as to be loved by all the people in the country without equal.

source_sentence: 時摩揭陀國影勝大王、憍薩羅國勝光大王、憍閃毘國明勝大王，及廣嚴城栗姑毘等，并餘貴族咸齎信物各遣使人，來就妙音求紺容女。
translation: The great king of Magadha, the great king of Vaiśravaṇa, the great king of Kośala, the great king of Vaiśravaṇa, the great king of Kaśinagara, the great king of Kauśinagara, the great king of Vaiśravaṇa, the great king of Vaiśravaṇa, the great king of Vaiśravaṇa, the great king of Vaiśravaṇa, the great king of Vaiśravaṇa

source_sentence: 長者愁惱作如是念：「來求女者多是國王，我若不與皆生怨恨容害於我。」
translation: The elder was distressed and thought, Those who come seeking women are mostly kings, and if I don't give them to them, they'll become enemies and harm me.

source_sentence: 報紺容曰：「今隨汝情，堪為偶對，可自選取。」
translation: He replied to Kumārajīva, Now, according to your feelings, you're capable of being a match; you can choose and take it yourself.

source_sentence: 時諸王使并餘貴族不期而會，於妙音長者花園中住。
translation: The king's envoys and other noble people then stayed in the garden of the elderly man Miaoyin without waiting to meet them.

source_sentence: 時彼長者即以種種上妙衣服無價珠瓔，莊飾紺容令乘大象，手執花鬘往眾人處：「汝所愛樂堪為夫者，當以此花擲彼身上。」
translation: The elder then dressed himself in various kinds of exquisite clothing with priceless pearls and jewelry, adorned his dark blue features, and ordered him to ride the great elephant.

source_sentence: 紺容即便詣眾人所問言：「曠野手王住在何處？」
translation: His dark complexion then went to the crowd and asked, Where's the king of the hands in the wilderness staying?

source_sentence: 眾人指示，女即以花望彼而擲，作如是語：「佛於藥叉手中所受童子，當為我夫。」
translation: The people instructed her, and the woman then looked at him with flowers and tossed them, saying, The boy accepted by the Buddha in Yakṣa's hand will be my husband.

source_sentence: 諸人聞已咸皆四散。
translation: All the people who heard it all dispersed in four directions.

source_sentence: 妙音長者知女意至，即為嚴整上妙象馬僕使車乘，種種衣服飾以珠瓔，禮送紺容往曠野處，夜闇門閉無由得入，權居門下假寐通宵。
translation: Knowing what she wished, the elder Miaoyin prepared a chariot for her. She was dressed in various garments decorated with pearls and jewelry, went into the wilderness in a graceful blue-colored posture, entered through the darkness of night when the door shut, and spent the whole night sleeping at the entrance of the king’s quarters.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊觀見曠野手堪應受化，乃至廣說，若曠野手與紺容相會者，染愛纏縛於生死中未能出離，無階聖果。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān observed that his hand in the wilderness was capable of being transformed, and explained in detail that if his hand in the wilderness confronted him with a dark blue complexion, he'd be bound by the bond of defilement and craving in birth-and-death and wouldn't be able to escape it, which is the noble fruit of having no steps.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知是事已，即從王舍往曠野城，至彼城隅日光遂沒，即於其夜臥牛跡搶地。
translation: Knowing this, the Bhagavān then left his king's house and went to the wilderness city. When he arrived at the corner of that city, the sunlight vanished, and on that night, he was lying on the tracks of a cow and plundered the ground.

source_sentence: 時曠野手聞佛世尊來至城外臥牛跡搶中，天既曉已，時曠野手欲禮世尊出城門下，見紺容女車馬僕從。
translation: The hands in the wilderness then heard that the Bhagavān had come to the outside of the city and was lying on the tracks of an ox. When dawn came, the gods said, “The hands in the wilderness wished to greet the Bhagavān.” They went out through the gate at the entrance of the city and saw a dark blue-colored woman, a chariot horse, and

source_sentence: 問：「是誰女宿此城門？」
translation: He asked, Who is the woman who stayed at this city gate?

source_sentence: 時紺容女具以來意答曠野手，王聞是事令往宮中。
translation: The king heard this and ordered her to go to the palace.

source_sentence: 時王詣佛所稽首白言：「世尊！
translation: The king then went to the Buddha, bowed his head and said, Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 不審大師宿在荒田得安隱不？」
translation: I wonder if the great master is staying in a wild field to attain peace?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「曠野手！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Free hand!

source_sentence: 於此世間得安隱眠者我為第一。」
translation: I'm the first in this world to attain peaceful sleep.

source_sentence: 「能除於罪惡，　　不被欲所繫；
translation: They will be able to remove sins and evil And not be bound by desire.

source_sentence: 離染歸圓寂，　　彼得安隱眠。
translation: Being free of defilement and returning to perfect quiescence, Peter sleeps peacefully.

source_sentence: 能除熱惱病，　　一切希望斷；
translation: Being able to remove feverish and painful illnesses, They cut off all hopes.

source_sentence: 其心常寂靜，　　彼得安隱眠。」
translation: Their minds are always quiescent, and Peter sleeps peacefully.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊說伽他曰：爾時世尊，為曠野手種種說法示教利喜，即於座上證不還果，廣說如《阿笈摩經》。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān spoke these verses: At that time the Bhagavat preached the Dharma in various ways to the people of the wilderness, encouraging, benefiting, and delighting them. He attained the fruit of nonreturning while sitting on his seat, as explained in detail in the abhidharma sūtras.

source_sentence: 禮佛足已從座而去，既還宮已語紺容曰：「我捨諸欲更不耽樂，汝雖來至，隨意去住無人遮止。」
translation: After bowing at the Buddha's feet, he departed from his seat and returned to the palace. Having returned, he said to Kumārajīva, I forsake all desires and don't indulge in them; even though you've come, there's no one to stop me if you want to go or stay.

source_sentence: 紺容曰：「我樂住此，願與佛子為給侍人。」
translation: The dark- complexed man said, I'm happy to stay here, and I wish to give it to the Buddha's son as an attendant.

source_sentence: 時曠野手為佛及僧，於此城外造僧住處，四事供養無所闕少，廣說乃至曠野手王遇疾而死，生無熱天，既起三心，來詣佛所禮足而坐。
translation: The hands in the wilderness then built a place for the Buddha and the saṃgha to live outside of this city, offering four kinds of support without missing anything, explaining it in detail up to the point where the hand king in the wilderness became ill and died, being born in the Heaven of No Heat. Having arisen with three thoughts, he came to the Buddha's feet, bowed his head at his feet, and

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝曠野手因何業故生無熱天？」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, What's the reason you're born in the Heaven of No Heat because of your actions in the wilderness?

source_sentence: 「我由見世尊，　　及得聞正法，
translation: Through seeing the World-honored One and hearing the true Dharma,

source_sentence: 供養於僧眾，　　曾無厭足心。
translation: Their offerings to the assembly of monks They never feel satisfied.

source_sentence: 受行勝人法，　　遠離於貪愛，
translation: Accepting and practicing the superior human teaching, he’s far removed from craving.

source_sentence: 於三事常修，　　故我生無熱。」
translation: Because they always cultivate these three things, I'll be born without fever.

source_sentence: 即以伽他答世尊曰：時曠野手天子，頂禮佛足忽然不現。

translation: Because he had nothing to lack as an offering from the eight mothers, he always provided for his children with milk, curds, butter, cooked butter, clarified butter, and other delicious foods. He grew up quickly like a lotus flower coming out of a pond.

source_sentence: 漸至童年學諸技藝、算數、書印，取與出納皆盡其妙，辯說開解智識聰明，於八種術善能瞻相，所謂男女、象馬、寶衣、木宅。
translation: Gradually, as a child, he studied arts and crafts, calculations, mathematics, and calligraphy, collected and accepted all of their marvelousness, spoke eloquently and enlightened wisdom and intelligence, and was well able to look at each other in eight ways, which were called men and women, elephants and horses, jeweled clothing, and wooden homes.

source_sentence: 其父爾時於春夏冬，為造三殿并三苑園，置三婇女，謂上、中、下，昇妙樓觀奏諸伎樂而娛樂之。
translation: At the time, in spring, summer, and winter, his father built three halls and three parks for him, and he installed three court ladies, namely, the upper, middle, and lower, who ascended to the marvelous palace to play music and amuse themselves.

translation: Seeing his father's own exertion, the son said, 'Why don't you eat at the right time in the evening?'

translation: When the son heard these words, he thought, 'My father, who was so old and venerable that he knew all the household chores for himself, preferred to be at leisurely and indulge in greedy desires; it's better to pursue his own pursuits to save his life.'

source_sentence: 即白父言：『口腹之重須自馳求，坐食父財是事不可。
translation: He then said to his father, 'The weight of my mouth and belly requires me to chase after it myself; I won't allow you to sit there and eat my father's property.

translation: Now, I want to go into the ocean and search for treasure.'

translation: The son frequently asked his father, 'I want to go on a general ship to the precious island for a while.'

source_sentence: 其父即便擊鼓宣令，普告城邑遠近商客：『諸君當知！

translation: When those women saw the auspicious banners move, they knew that there were Jambudvīpa's men and boats breaking up and arriving, so they caught us and ate them in order, leaving the rest who hadn't eaten inside the iron city.

translation: Those women aren't human beings, but they are all Rāṣṭrapāla.

translation: It's advisable for you to guard yourself well, and soon you'll also be subject to this misfortune.'

source_sentence: 是時商主聞斯語已便大驚怖，告彼人曰：『頗有方便仁及我曹免斯苦厄，平安吉達還贍部洲不？』
translation: After hearing these words, the merchant lord was greatly frightened and told that man, 'Could you, Mañjuśrī and I be spared this painful misfortune by returning safely to Jambudvīpa?'

source_sentence: 彼便告曰：『我無方便可得還至贍部洲中重見鄉國。
translation: He then told them, 'There's no way for me to return to Jambudvīpa and see my native land again.

source_sentence: 何以故？
translation: Why is it so?

source_sentence: 我知業重求脫無緣，我等共念穿鐵城下令作孔穴，欲求逃難冀免縶縛，其城即便更寬數倍。
translation: Knowing that karma is heavy and there are no reasons to seek liberation, we all think of penetrating through the iron wall so that it becomes a hole or cave, and wanting to escape in order to avoid being bound by bondage, that wall will be several times as wide.

source_sentence: 復欲踰越而出城遂增高，故知我等無緣得脫，以待命終。
translation: Again, they want to cross over and leave the city, which then grows in height, so they know that we won't be able to escape without conditions until our lives end.

translation: You may have the opportunity to return to your native land.'

source_sentence: 商主問曰：『其事云何？』
translation: The merchant owner asked, 'What's the matter?'

source_sentence: 彼便告曰：『我比曾聞，於十五日褒灑陀時，於虛空中有諸天人作如是語：「贍部洲人！
translation: He then told them, 'I've never heard such a thing before. On the fifteenth day in Praṣāda, there were gods and humans in space who said, 'People of Jambudvīpa!

source_sentence: 汝無智慧故守愚癡，於十五日褒灑陀時，不解北行尋求出路。
translation: You lack wisdom and therefore remain ignorant. On the fifteenth day of the month, you won't understand the path leading north and look for a way out when you go to Praṣāda.

source_sentence: 每十五日有天馬王名婆羅訶，從海而出遊在岸邊，食自然香稻無病充溢有大力勢，舉首四顧如是三告：『誰有欲向彼岸還贍部洲？』」
translation: Every fifteen days, there's a celestial horse king named Bālāha who emerges from the ocean and travels to the edge of the shore, eats naturally fragrant rice without illness, fills it with great vigor, raises his head and looks around like this three times, saying, 'Who has the intention to go to the other side and return to Jambudvī?'

source_sentence: 君等宜應於十五日褒灑陀時，於城北邊大海之際至天馬所，待馬語時即便告言：「我等欲歸彼岸還贍部洲，願見提携安隱而去。」
translation: It's better for you to say that on the fifteenth day, at the time of Praṣāda, you should go to the gods and horses at the northern seashore of the city and tell them as they speak, 'We want to return to Jambudvīpa and wish to see Tiṣya and leave in peace.'

source_sentence: 馬所陳語君當奉行。
translation: What you say to the horse, you will follow it.

translation: If you have this method, you can return to your native land.'

source_sentence: 時師子胤商主聞彼說已，深心奉持讚歎希有，即便下樹尋路歸還依舊而臥。
translation: After hearing what he said, Shizi Yin, the merchant lord, deeply venerated it with admiration and praised its rareness, went down a tree to search for a way to return home, remained there, and lay down.

source_sentence: 「至天曉已詣彼五百商人之所，而告之曰：『君等宜可俱集某園，須有籌議，所有妻子並勿隨身。』
translation: When dawn came, he went to the five hundred merchants and told them, 'Should you all gather together at a certain park for some deliberation, so that you won't go along with your wives and children?'

source_sentence: 時諸商人聞商主語，於一園中並皆俱集，商主即便具以上事普告眾人，復更告曰：『此等諸女皆是羅剎，君等宜應謹自防護。』
translation: When the merchants heard what the merchant lord said, they all gathered together in one park, and the merchant lord then told them all these things, and he also told them, 'These women are all Rāṣṭrapāla, so you should be careful to guard yourself.'
